summary: This document appears to be preparation notes for a witness (likely a former housekeeper or staff member) for trial testimony regarding her work at Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach house. It details her recollections about her job, interactions with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, creating a document for payment, and an incident where an irate woman came to the house demanding money.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE; the owner of the Palm Beach house where the witness worked; was introduced to the witness by Ghislaine Maxwell on her first day.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as GM; lived at the Palm Beach house and introduced the witness to Jeffrey Epstein; the witness rarely interacted with her at the house.

connections.description: Maxwell lived at Epstein's Palm Beach house and introduced staff (the witness) to him.
Epstein employed Maxwell, who managed his Palm Beach household and staff.

events.title: Witness's First Day at Epstein House
events.description: The witness met Jeffrey Epstein on her first day working at the Palm Beach house; she was introduced to him by Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Irate Woman Demands Payment at House
events.description: An irate woman came to Epstein's Palm Beach house demanding to see him for money. The witness, after consulting a housekeeper, called 'NY' (likely Epstein's New York office) and was instructed to pay the woman cash to get rid of her.

events.title: FBI Contact
events.description: The witness states she does not recall giving any documents to the FBI in 2006.

locations: Palm Beach house (Jeffrey Epstein's property in Palm Beach, referenced as 'PB house')
New York (referred to as 'NY', likely Epstein's office there)
keyFacts: A witness (likely a former staff member) prepared to testify about working at Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach house, where Ghislaine Maxwell also lived.
The witness created a meticulous document (GX 607) to log hours and tasks in order to get paid, but does not recall what she did with it or giving it to the FBI in 2006.
An incident occurred where an irate woman came to the house demanding money from Epstein; the witness was instructed by someone in 'NY' to pay her cash to make her leave.
The witness left the job due to stress, earned $20/hour, and was not fired or given severance pay.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs, indicating sensitive or restricted information.
